title: Add a "silence" behavior to completely turn off deprecation warnings.
body:
Cherry-picking all commits from #5852, that Github for some reason is not showing. Should be ok to go now.

Closes #5852

/cc @jeremy @twinturbo

title: Upgrade sprockets version to 2.2.0
body:
This version fixes encoding issues under Ruby 1.9. 

I prefer do a conservative upgrade to 2.2.0 in 3-2-stable branch. In master I upgraded it to 2.4.0

title: Added comment on how to enable gzip compression
body: Disabled by default but should be handy for people running rails without using any frontend proxy e.g Cedar stack on Heroku. Added in production environment on advice from @sikachu, as that's the place it going to be needed.

title: Added comment on how to enable gzip compression
body: This should be handy for people running rails without using any frontend proxy e.g Cedar stack on Heroku.

title: Remote ip logic and validation.
body:
I did this couple times already in pull requests #1758 and #2035 for earlier rails version. I still think that logic in remote_ip is not ideal and don't cover some important things.

/cc @jeremy, @sikachu

title: sqlite supports explain too
body: Sqlite3 adapter is inherited from sqlite and it supports explain. And based on https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/sqlite_adapter.rb#L121 we may say that sqlite adapter supports explain too.

title: cleanliness in method parameters
body:
For all connection adapters method ```translate_exception``` has 2 parameters ```exception``` and ```message```. 

https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract_mysql_adapter.rb#L588

https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/postgresql_adapter.rb#L1245

https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/sqlite_adapter.rb#L552

But in parent class this method has another parameters. Let's clean up this.

title: already defined in quoting
body: This method already defined in https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract/quoting.rb#L90 and included here https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract_adapter.rb#L51

title: Always quote hstore keys and values
body: `escape_hstore` uses quotation marks around keys and values only if it seems necessary. However, it currently breaks in the presence of some non-ASCII characters. Instead of trying to guess which characters are safe, it seems better to always use quotes.

title: Build fix for 3-2-stable
body: Add extra order clause to fix failing test on Ruby 1.8.7, related to hash ordering.

title: added predicate methods for AR store attributes
body: AR store attributes now have predicate methods (model.store_attribute?) like regular attributes.

title: Fix build. It seems that the Mocha's behavior were changed.
body: This was a backport from `master`.

title: Fix secure_password setter
body: I think the password attribute should not update if we don't generate a new password.

title: Fix build. It seems that the Mocha's behavior were changed.
body:
I think that the Mocha's behavior were changed.
* Mocha::StubbingError: stubbing method on nil
* Mocha::StubbingError: can't stub method on frozen object

BTW: we can change a behavior of stubbing method on nil
by Mocha::Configuration.allow(:stubbing_method_on_nil)

title: Remove tests for undocumented private methods
body:
`hash_for_*` methods are private and not designed to be called by end user. 

Their API can be changed without backward compatibility, that is why they should not be tested.

title: ActionDispatch::HTTP::Url#url_for refactor method
body:
Separated left side url generation(before query string)
from right side url generation(after query string)

title: Delete insecure and "bad practice" code.
body: related: http://homakov.blogspot.com/2012/04/whitelist-your-routes-match-is-evil.html

title: Refactor hash creation in routeset
body: See https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/5957/files#r725801

title: Create a new errors reference in dup
body: If an ActiveRecord instance is cloned, this keeps track of errors of this 'parent', because both errors instances point to the same ActiveModel::Errors instance. This happen when before to call dup, save or valid? is called

title: RouteSet: decomplecting a way to handle positional args
body:
Currently positional arguments are handle with a nasty hack: bypassing them though options hash.
This make code wider and harder to understand.

This patch merges it all together and removes `options[:_positional_args]` and `options[:_positional_keys]` hack.

Ensure no performance degrade:

https://gist.github.com/2479082


```

$ diffbench perf.rb
Running benchmark with current working tree
Stashing changes
Running benchmark with clean working tree
Applying stashed changes back

                    user     system      total        real
----------------------------------Url helper module builder
After patch:    0.410000   0.000000   0.410000 (  0.409276)
Before patch:   0.410000   0.000000   0.410000 (  0.413838)

--------------------------------------simple URL generation
After patch:    0.010000   0.000000   0.010000 (  0.005349)
Before patch:   0.000000   0.000000   0.000000 (  0.005511)

--------------------URL generation with optional parameters
After patch:    0.090000   0.000000   0.090000 (  0.091728)
Before patch:   0.100000   0.000000   0.100000 (  0.092634)

title: RouteSet: simplify routes helpers generation code
body:
Removed complicated route generation structure:

``` diff
- {:url => {:only_path => false}, :path => {:only_path => true}}.each do |kind, opts|
+ [true, false].each do |only_path|
```

Which improve the code readability and reduce string concatenation and hash merge overhead.

title: Locking mocha to older version as waiting to fix from mocha.
body:
See #5907 and 
https://github.com/floehopper/mocha/pull/77

title: ActiveRecord support for where_not
body:
It's incredibly annoying to negate things in Active Record! I can do:

    Person.where(:name => "Jacob")

but to negate it, I'd have to use a SQL fragment like this:

    Person.where("name <> ? ", "Jacob")

I want support:

    Person.where(:name.not => "Jacob")

(see: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/5948)

But barring that, let's support:

    Person.where_not(:name => "Jacob")
